info.name: Snowflake Grant API
info.description:
The Snowflake Grant API is a REST API that you can use to show or manage privileges that have been provided to users and roles in a Snowflake database.

Contact Support:
 Name: Snowflake, Inc.
 Email: support@snowflake.com

item.name: Revoke the grant option for the specified privilege on the named securable from the named grantee.

query.description: If "cascade", recursively revoke the grant from sub-grantees to which this privilege was re-granted. Acceptable values are "restrict" or "cascade".

variable.description: (Required) String that specifies the type of resource that is the privilege grantee.
(Required) String that specifies the name of the privilege grantee.
(Required) String that specifies the type of resource that is being secured by a privilege.
(Required) String that specifies the name of resource that is being secured by a privilege.
(Required) String that specifies a privilege to be revoked

request.description: Endpoint to indicate that the grant option for the privilege listed in the path should be revoked.

response.name: Successful request.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

query.description: If "cascade", recursively revoke the grant from sub-grantees to which this privilege was re-granted. Acceptable values are "restrict" or "cascade".

response.name: Successfully accepted the request, but it is not completed yet.

item.name: Revoke the grant option for the specified privilege on the specified all/future securable in the given scope from the named grantee.

query.description: If "cascade", recursively revoke the grant from sub-grantees to which this privilege was re-granted. Acceptable values are "restrict" or "cascade".

variable.description: (Required) String that specifies the type of resource that is the privilege grantee.
(Required) String that specifies the name of the privilege grantee.
(Required) String that species whether this group privilege should be on ALL or FUTURE resources of the specified plural type

(Required) String that specifies the plural of the type of resource that is being secured by an ALL/FUTURE privilege. Must be either "schemas" or any plural object type that can nest under a schema such as "tables"
(Required) String that specifies the type of resource that is the scope of an ALL/FUTURE privilege. Can only be DATABASE or SCHEMA
(Required) String that specifies the name of resource that is the scope of an ALL/FUTURE privilege
(Required) String that specifies a privilege to be revoked

request.description: Endpoint to indicate that the grant option for the privilege listed on the group securable in the given scope should be revoked.

response.name: Successful request.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

query.description: If "cascade", recursively revoke the grant from sub-grantees to which this privilege was re-granted. Acceptable values are "restrict" or "cascade".

(Required) String that specifies the type of resource that is the scope of an ALL/FUTURE privilege. Can only be DATABASE or SCHEMA
(Required) String that specifies the name of resource that is the scope of an ALL/FUTURE privilege

response.name: Limit Exceeded. The number of requests hit the rate limit. The application must slow down the frequency of hitting the API endpoints.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Internal Server Error. The server hit an unrecoverable system error. The response body may include the error code and message for further guidance. The application owner may need to reach out the customer support.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Service Unavailable. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Gateway Timeout. The request was not processed due to server side timeouts. The application may retry with backoff. The jittered backoff is recommended.

item.name: List of privileges associated with this grantee type and name

query.description: Query parameter to limit the maximum number of rows returned by a command.

variable.description: (Required) String that specifies the type of resource that is the privilege grantee.

request.description: List the roles and privileges granted to the specified grantee using the output of SHOW GRANTS TO
